meals.name: Soft and Chewy Christmas Sprinkle Sugar Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Soft and Chewy Christmas Sprinkle Sugar Cookies

**Yield:** 15 cookies
**Prep:** 15 min | **Bake:** 12 min

### Ingredients
- 14 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- 2 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup holiday sprinkles

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, combine butter and sugars. Beat on low until combined, then increase to medium-high and beat until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add eggs - Scrape bowl sides, add egg, egg yolk, vanilla, and almond extract. Beat on medium-high until fluffy and lightened, about 2 minutes.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Beat on low until just combined. Fold in sprinkles gently.

5. Scoop dough - Use a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop to portion dough. Place on prepared sheets, spacing 2 inches apart.

6. Bake - 11-12 minutes until edges are set but centers remain soft. Cool slightly before serving.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/soft-and-chewy-christmas-sprinkle-sugar-cookies/)

meals.name: Apple Crisp Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Apple Crisp Cookies

**Yield:** 10 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 15-16 min

### Ingredients

**Crisp Topping:**
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- 3 tablespoons light brown sugar
- 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 3 tablespoons old fashioned oats
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 large apple, peeled, cored, and diced
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger

**Optional Vanilla Icing:**
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 1 tablespoon milk
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Pinch of salt

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Make crisp topping - Combine melted butter, brown sugar, flour, oats, and cinnamon until mixture clumps.

3. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add egg and vanilla, beat 1 minute.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Beat on low until combined.

5. Add apples - Toss apple pieces with cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Fold into dough.

6. Scoop and top - Scoop dough with 2-ounce scoop. Press crisp topping over each ball.

7. Bake - 15-16 minutes until puffed and set at edges. Cool 5 minutes.

8. Add icing - Whisk icing ingredients and drizzle over cookies if desired.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/apple-crisp-cookies/)

meals.name: Brown Butter Walnut Chocolate Chip Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Brown Butter Walnut Chocolate Chip Cookies

**Yield:** 15 cookies
**Prep:** 45 min | **Bake:** 12-13 min

### Ingredients
- 1 cup walnuts, roughly chopped
- 3/4 cup (168g) unsalted butter
- 1 cup (200g) packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk, room temperature
- 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract
- 1 3/4 cup (220g) all-purpose flour
- 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
- Flaky salt for topping

### Instructions

1. Toast walnuts - Toast at 375°F for 5-7 minutes until golden.

2. Brown butter - Brown butter in saucepan over medium-low heat until golden with brown bits, 5-7 minutes. Cool slightly.

3. Mix wet ingredients - Combine brown butter and sugars. Add egg, egg yolk, and vanilla; mix well.

4. Add dry ingredients - Fold in flour, baking soda, and salt until no streaks remain.

5. Add mix-ins - Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.

6. Shape dough - Scoop into 1.5-ounce balls. Refrigerate at least 30 more minutes.

7. Bake - Preheat oven to 350°F. Bake 12-13 minutes until edges are golden. Top with flaky salt.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/brown-butter-walnut-chocolate-chip-cookies/)

meals.name: Single Serve Funfetti Cookie
meals.instructions:
## Single Serve Funfetti Cookie

**Yield:** 2 cookies
**Prep:** 10 min | **Bake:** 12-13 min

### Ingredients
- 2 tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, room temperature
- 2 tablespoons (26g) packed light brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon (13g) granulated sugar
- 1 large egg yolk
- Splash vanilla extract
- Splash almond extract
- 5 tablespoons (39g) all-purpose flour
- 1/8 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/8 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons white chocolate, chopped
- 1 tablespoon rainbow sprinkles

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Mix wet ingredients - Mix butter and sugars until combined.

3. Add egg - Add egg yolk, vanilla, and almond extract; mix well.

4. Add dry ingredients - Stir in flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Fold in white chocolate and sprinkles.

5. Shape and bake - Divide dough in half and roll into balls. Place 3 inches apart.

6. Bake - 12-13 minutes until edges are set but center remains soft.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/single-serve-funfetti-cookie/)

meals.name: Banana Cream Pie Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Banana Cream Pie Cookies

**Yield:** 14 cookies
**Prep:** 45 min | **Bake:** 12 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup light brown sugar, packed
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 1/2 cups Nilla wafer crumbs

**Topping:**
- 1 packet (3.4 oz) vanilla instant pudding mix
- 2/3 cup whole milk
- Pinch of salt
- 1 cup heavy whipping cream
- 1 large banana, sliced into rounds

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add egg - Add egg and vanilla; beat until smooth.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix in Nilla wafer crumbs.

5. Scoop dough - Scoop 1.5-ounce dough balls, space 2 inches apart.

6. Bake - 12 minutes until edges are set but centers soft. Cool completely.

7. Make topping - Whisk pudding mix with milk and salt. Refrigerate until thickened.

8. Whip cream - Whip heavy cream to medium peaks. Fold in pudding.

9. Assemble - Top cookies with banana slices and pipe cream mixture on top.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/banana-cream-pie-cookies/)

meals.name: Neapolitan Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Neapolitan Cookies

**Yield:** 12 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 15 min

### Ingredients
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 1/3 cups + 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/3 cup freeze-dried strawberries, finely ground
- 1 tablespoon Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar (for coating)

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add egg - Add egg and vanilla; beat until smooth.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add 1 1/3 cups flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt; mix until combined.

5. Divide and flavor - Divide dough into thirds. Add 1 tbsp flour to first, freeze-dried strawberries to second, cocoa powder to third.

6. Create marbled balls - Take one ball from each flavor, press together and roll until combined.

7. Coat and bake - Roll in granulated sugar. Place 2 inches apart. Bake 12-14 minutes until edges are golden. Cool before serving.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/neapolitan-cookies/)

meals.name: Lemon Blueberry White Chocolate Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Lemon Blueberry White Chocolate Cookies

**Yield:** 12 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 15 min

### Ingredients
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon extract
- 1 tablespoon lemon zest
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup frozen blueberries
- 1/4 cup blueberry preserves
- 4 ounces white chocolate, roughly chopped

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add wet ingredients - Add egg, vanilla, lemon extract, and lemon zest. Beat until smooth.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Beat on low until combined.

5. Add mix-ins - Fold in frozen blueberries and white chocolate. Drop blueberry preserves in spoonfuls and fold gently for ripple effect.

6. Scoop and bake - Scoop 1.5-ounce dough balls, place 2 inches apart. Bake 12-15 minutes until puffed and set around edges. Garnish with lemon zest.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/lemon-blueberry-cookies/)

meals.name: Salted Pistachio Chocolate Chunk Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Salted Pistachio Chocolate Chunk Cookies

**Yield:** 14 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 12-14 min

### Ingredients
- 3/4 cup (100g) roasted pistachios, finely ground
- 3/4 cup (170g) unsalted butter, melted
- 3/4 cup (150g) packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract (optional)
- 1 3/4 cups (220g) all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2.5 ounces white chocolate, roughly chopped
- 3 ounces dark chocolate, roughly chopped
- Flaky salt for topping

### Instructions

1. Grind pistachios - Pulse pistachios in food processor until finely ground (don't over-blend).

2. Mix wet ingredients - Combine melted butter and sugars. Add egg, egg yolk, vanilla, and almond extract; mix well.

3. Add dry ingredients - Add ground pistachios, flour, baking soda, and salt. Fold until combined.

4. Add chocolate - Fold in white and dark chocolate. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes.

5. Bake - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Scoop 2-ounce dough balls, space 2 inches apart. Bake 12-14 minutes until edges are golden and centers gooey. Top with flaky salt.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/salted-pistachio-chocolate-chunk-cookies/)

meals.name: The BEST Sugar Cookies
meals.instructions:
## The BEST Sugar Cookies

**Yield:** 20 medium cookies
**Prep:** 10 min | **Chill:** 1 hour | **Bake:** 10 min

### Ingredients
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg, at room temperature
- 1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- 1 3/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

### Instructions

1. Mix wet ingredients - Beat butter and sugar until just combined, about 45 seconds. Add egg, vanilla, and almond extract; beat 1 minute.

2. Add dry ingredients - Add flour and salt, mixing until combined. Form into flat disk, wrap in plastic. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

3. Preheat - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper.

4. Roll and cut - Roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness on floured surface. Cut shapes, place on sheets.

5. Bake - Sprinkle with colored sugar if desired. Bake 8-12 minutes until edges are just golden.

6. Cool - Cool completely before frosting or serve plain.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/sugar-cookies/)

meals.name: Peppermint Crinkle Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Peppermint Crinkle Cookies

**Yield:** 16 cookies
**Prep:** 20 min | **Bake:** 10 min

### Ingredients

**Coating:**
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 2/3 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs, room temperature
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 3/4 teaspoon peppermint extract
- 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper. Separate sugars into bowls.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add eggs - Add eggs, vanilla, and peppermint extract. Beat until smooth and fluffy.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Beat on low until combined.

5. Coat dough balls - Scoop 1.5-ounce dough balls. Roll in granulated sugar first, then powdered sugar.

6. Bake - 9-10 minutes until cracked and firm at edges but soft in center.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/peppermint-crinkle-cookies-but-like-actually-brookies/)

meals.name: Gingerbread Iced Oatmeal Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Gingerbread Iced Oatmeal Cookies

**Yield:** 15 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 9-10 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 3/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 2/3 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tablespoons molasses
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup old fashioned oats
- 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

**Icing:**
- 1 1/3 cups powdered sugar
- 2 tablespoons milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Pinch of salt

### Instructions

1. Mix wet ingredients - Combine melted butter, sugars, and molasses. Add egg, egg yolk, and vanilla; mix well.

2. Add dry ingredients - Fold in flour, oats, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and salt. Let dough rest 10 minutes.

3. Scoop and bake - Preheat oven to 350°F. Scoop 1.5-ounce dough balls, space 2 inches apart. Bake 9-10 minutes until puffed and edges are light golden.

4. Add icing - Whisk icing ingredients. Spoon over warm cookies and spread to edges. Let set.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/gingerbread-iced-oatmeal-cookies/)

meals.name: Soft Gingerbread Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Soft Gingerbread Cookies

**Yield:** 20 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Chill:** 2 hours | **Bake:** 8-9 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup shortening (or butter)
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 cup molasses
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 2 teaspoons ground ginger
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

**Royal Icing:**
- 1 egg white
- 1 1/4 cups powdered sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Pinch of salt

### Instructions

1. Melt base - Combine shortening, sugar, and molasses in saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until melted. Cool slightly.

2. Mix wet ingredients - Whisk egg and vanilla into cooled mixture.

3. Add dry ingredients - Fold in flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, and salt. Wrap dough and chill at least 2 hours.

4. Roll and cut - Preheat oven to 350°F. Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut shapes, place 2 inches apart.

5. Bake - 8-9 minutes until edges are lightly browned. Cool completely.

6. Decorate - Whisk icing ingredients. Pipe onto cooled cookies.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/soft-gingerbread-cookies/)

meals.name: Soft and Chewy Buckeye Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Soft and Chewy Buckeye Cookies

**Yield:** 10 cookies
**Prep:** 45 min | **Bake:** 12 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg, at room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/3 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

**Peanut Butter Filling:**
- 1 cup peanut butter
- 2/3 cup powdered sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

**Chocolate Topping:**
- 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips
- 1/4 cup heavy cream

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add egg - Add egg and vanilla; beat until fluffy and pale.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Beat on low until combined.

5. Bake - Scoop 2-ounce dough balls, space 2 inches apart. Bake 11-12 minutes. Press cookie scoop into centers to create indentations. Cool completely.

6. Make filling - Mix peanut butter filling ingredients. Scoop onto cooled cookies.

7. Make ganache - Heat cream, pour over chocolate chips. Stir until smooth. Top each cookie with ganache. Let set 30 minutes.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/soft-and-chewy-buckeye-cookies/)

meals.name: White Chocolate Pistachio Cranberry Slice and Bake Cookies
meals.instructions:
## White Chocolate Pistachio Cranberry Slice and Bake Cookies

**Yield:** 50 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Chill:** 2 hours | **Bake:** 10 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 3/4 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg yolk
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- 1 3/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup unsalted pistachios, finely chopped, divided
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries, roughly chopped
- 4 ounces white chocolate, finely chopped

**Optional White Chocolate Coating:**
- 4 ounces white chocolate, finely chopped
- 1 teaspoon coconut oil

### Instructions

1. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

2. Add egg - Add egg yolk, vanilla, and almond extract. Beat until smooth.

3. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour and salt, beat on low until combined. Fold in 1/2 cup pistachios, cranberries, and chocolate.

4. Shape logs - Divide dough in half. Roll each into 12-inch log, 1-inch diameter. Roll in remaining pistachios. Wrap and refrigerate 2 hours.

5. Slice and bake - Preheat oven to 350°F. Cut logs into 1/4-inch rounds. Bake 10 minutes until golden. Cool completely.

6. Add coating - For coating: melt white chocolate with coconut oil. Dip or drizzle cookies.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/white-chocolate-pistachio-cranberry-slice-and-bake-cookies/)

meals.name: Pumpkin Pie Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Pumpkin Pie Cookies

**Yield:** 14 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 15 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 3/4 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 1 tablespoon milk
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs

**Pumpkin Filling:**
- 1/3 cup pumpkin puree
- 3 tablespoons packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg
- 1 tablespoon evaporated milk
- 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until combined. Add egg, milk, and vanilla.

3. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, graham cracker crumbs, baking powder, and salt. Beat until combined.

4. Shape cookies - Scoop 1.5-ounce dough balls. Flatten and press thumb into center. Bake 5 minutes.

5. Make filling - Whisk pumpkin filling ingredients together.

6. Fill and bake - Remove cookies after 5 minutes. Reshape center divot. Spoon 2 teaspoons filling into each center. Bake 6-8 more minutes until golden and filling sets. Top with whipped cream if desired.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/pumpkin-pie-cookies/)

meals.name: Dirty Chai Snickerdoodles
meals.instructions:
## Dirty Chai Snickerdoodles

**Yield:** 16 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 12-13 min

### Ingredients

**Dirty Chai Sugar:**
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1 teaspoon ground cardamom
- 1/2 teaspoon espresso powder
- 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves
- Crack of fresh black pepper

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk, room temperature
- 1 tablespoon plain Greek yogurt
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1 teaspoon ground cardamom
- 1/2 teaspoon espresso powder
- 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves
- Crack of fresh black pepper
- 1 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Make chai sugar - Mix dirty chai sugar ingredients in small bowl.

3. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugars until fluffy, about 2 minutes.

4. Add wet ingredients - Add egg, egg yolk, Greek yogurt, and vanilla. Beat until fluffy and pale.

5. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, spices, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt. Beat until combined.

6. Shape and coat - Scoop 2-ounce dough balls. Roll in dirty chai sugar. Space 3 inches apart.

7. Bake - 12-13 minutes until crackled and soft in center.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/dirty-chai-snickerdoodles/)

meals.name: Homemade Nutter Butters
meals.instructions:
## Homemade Nutter Butters

**Yield:** 16 sandwich cookies
**Prep:** 45 min | **Bake:** 10 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 3/4 cup creamy peanut butter
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

**Filling:**
- 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter
- 2/3 cup powdered sugar
- 3-4 tablespoons heavy cream
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat peanut butter, butter, and brown sugar until fluffy. Add egg and vanilla.

3. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt. Beat until combined.

4. Shape cookies - Scoop 1-ounce portions into oval discs. Pinch middle to resemble peanut shape. Make crosshatches with fork.

5. Bake - 9-10 minutes until puffed and set. Cool completely.

6. Make filling - Beat peanut butter, powdered sugar, cream, and vanilla until smooth.

7. Assemble - Match cookies into pairs. Pipe filling onto one half, sandwich together.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/homemade-nutter-butters/)

meals.name: Apple Fritter Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Apple Fritter Cookies

**Yield:** 16 cookies
**Prep:** 45 min | **Bake:** 15 min

### Ingredients

**Apple Mixture:**
- 1 large apple, peeled, cored and diced (Granny Smith recommended)
- 2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 2/3 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg, at room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 2/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger

**Maple Glaze:**
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1 tablespoon pure maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons milk
- Heavy pinch of salt

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper.

2. Prepare apples - Toss diced apple with brown sugar and cinnamon.

3. Cream butter - Beat butter and brown sugar until fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add egg and vanilla.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, spices, and salt. Beat until combined. Fold in apple mixture.

5. Bake - Scoop 2-ounce dough balls, space 2 inches apart. Bake 12-15 minutes until puffed and set at edges.

6. Glaze - Whisk glaze ingredients together. Spoon over hot cookies. Let set 10 minutes.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/apple-fritter-cookies/)

meals.name: Key Lime Pie Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Key Lime Pie Cookies

**Yield:** 10 cookies
**Prep:** 40 min | **Bake:** 14 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup light brown sugar, packed
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 tablespoon fresh key lime zest
- 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs

**Key Lime Pie Filling:**
- 4 ounces cream cheese, room temperature
- 2 tablespoons fresh key lime juice
- 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F; line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and both sugars until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

3. Add wet ingredients - Add egg, vanilla, lime juice, and lime zest; beat until smooth (about 1 minute).

4. Mix dry ingredients - Mix in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt on low speed until combined; add graham cracker crumbs.

5. Shape cookies - Scoop dough using a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop; create indentations in centers with thumb.

6. Bake - 12-14 minutes until edges are firm; reshape indentations while hot. Cool completely.

7. Make filling - Combine all filling ingredients; beat until smooth.

8. Fill and chill - Spoon filling into cookie centers; chill at least 1 hour before serving.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/key-lime-pie-cookies/)

meals.name: Strawberry Shortcake Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Strawberry Shortcake Cookies

**Yield:** 12 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 15 min

### Ingredients

**Crumble Topping:**
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- 2 tablespoons light brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
- Pinch of salt

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg, at room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 2/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 6 strawberries, washed, hulled and sliced
- 1/4 cup strawberry preserves

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F and line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Make crumble - Mix flour, brown sugar, granulated sugar, salt, and melted butter until clumpy; set aside.

3. Cream butter - Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

4. Add egg - Add egg and vanilla; beat until smooth (about 1 minute).

5. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; mix on low until just combined.

6. Add strawberries - Fold in sliced strawberries, then gently fold in preserves without overmixing.

7. Top and bake - Scoop dough onto baking sheet with 2-inch spacing; top each with 1 teaspoon crumble. Bake 12-15 minutes until set around edges but soft in center; cool 5 minutes before transferring to rack.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/strawberry-shortcake-cookies/)

meals.name: Soft and Chewy Marble Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Soft and Chewy Marble Cookies

**Yield:** 10 cookies
**Prep:** 20 min | **Bake:** 13 min

### Ingredients
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk, at room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cup + 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 1 cup chocolate chips

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F and line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - In stand mixer with paddle attachment, combine butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar. Beat on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.

3. Add eggs - Scrape bowl sides with spatula, add egg and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth and combined.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add 1 1/2 cups flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Mix until just combined with no flour streaks remaining.

5. Divide and flavor - Divide dough in half. To first bowl, add remaining 3 tablespoons flour and 1/2 cup chocolate chips. To second bowl, add 3 tablespoons cocoa powder and 1/2 cup chocolate chips. Stir each to combine.

6. Create marble effect - Using 0.5-ounce cookie scoop, alternate stacking four dough balls (vanilla, chocolate, vanilla, chocolate). Press together and roll into balls. Repeat with remaining dough.

7. Bake - Place balls 2 inches apart on prepared cookie sheet. Bake at 350°F for 12-14 minutes until edges are golden brown and centers have puffed but remain slightly underdone. Cool for a few minutes on baking sheet, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/soft-and-chewy-marble-cookies/)

meals.name: Tiramisu Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Tiramisu Cookies

**Yield:** 12 cookies
**Prep:** 40 min | **Bake:** 13-14 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1/2 cup light brown sugar, packed
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 2/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup espresso powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

**Mascarpone Frosting:**
- 1/3 cup heavy cream
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 8 ounces mascarpone cheese
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Pinch of salt
- Dutch-process cocoa powder for dusting

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

3. Add egg - Add egg and vanilla extract; beat until combined.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, espresso powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt on low speed until just combined.

5. Scoop and bake - Using a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop, place dough on baking sheet, spacing 2 inches apart. Bake 13-14 minutes until edges are set but centers remain slightly gooey. Cool completely on cooling rack.

6. Make frosting - Beat heavy cream and powdered sugar until combined (about 20 seconds). Add mascarpone, vanilla, and salt; beat only until combined (about 30 seconds). Pipe onto cooled cookies.

7. Dust - Dust with cocoa powder before serving.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/tiramisu-cookies/)

meals.name: Funfetti Crinkle Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Funfetti Crinkle Cookies

**Yield:** 16 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 12 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon almond extract
- 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/3 cup rainbow sprinkles

**Coating:**
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup powdered sugar

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F; line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - In stand mixer with paddle attachment, combine butter and granulated sugar. Beat on medium-to-high speed until light, fluffy, and pale (about 2 minutes).

3. Add eggs - Scrape bowl sides; add eggs, vanilla, and almond extract. Beat until smooth and combined.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir on low speed until combined with no flour streaks remaining. Don't overmix.

5. Add sprinkles - Fold in rainbow sprinkles until evenly distributed.

6. Coat and shape - Fill two small bowls with granulated sugar and powdered sugar separately. Using a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop, roll dough balls first in granulated sugar, then in powdered sugar until fully coated.

7. Bake - Place cookies 2 inches apart on prepared sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are set and centers have puffed but remain gooey. Cool completely before serving.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/funfetti-crinkle-cookies/)

meals.name: Red Velvet Cheesecake Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Red Velvet Cheesecake Cookies

**Yield:** 16 cookies
**Prep:** 1 hour | **Freeze:** 1 hour | **Bake:** 15-16 min

### Ingredients

**Cheesecake Center:**
- 6 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup light brown sugar
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 large egg + 1 large egg yolk, at room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon red gel food coloring
- 1/3 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar (optional for rolling)

### Instructions

1. Make cheesecake centers - Mix softened cream cheese, powdered sugar, flour, vanilla, and salt until smooth. Pipe into discs on parchment paper and freeze for at least 1 hour.

2. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

3. Cream butter - Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add egg, yolk, and vanilla. Mix in red food coloring.

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add cocoa powder, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix until combined.

5. Assemble cookies - Scoop dough, flatten slightly, place frozen cheesecake center on top, and seal edges.

6. Bake - Roll in sugar if desired. Place on prepared sheet 2 inches apart. Bake 14-16 minutes until puffed and crinkled. Cool slightly, then transfer to cooling rack.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/red-velvet-cheesecake-cookies/)

meals.name: Chocolate Covered Strawberry Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Chocolate Covered Strawberry Cookies

**Yield:** 12 cookies
**Prep:** 20 min | **Bake:** 12 min

### Ingredients

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1 cup packed light brown sugar
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/3 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup freeze-dried strawberries
- 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips

**Chocolate Coating:**
- 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
- 1 teaspoon coconut oil

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, beat butter and brown sugar on medium-high speed until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

3. Add egg - Scrape bowl sides, then add egg and vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until light and pale (about 2 minutes).

4. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Beat on low speed until combined with no flour streaks (about 30 seconds). Fold in freeze-dried strawberries and chocolate chips.

5. Bake - Using a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop, portion dough onto prepared sheets, spacing 2 inches apart. Bake 10-12 minutes until cookies puff and are firm at edges but gooey in center. Cool on baking sheets for 15 minutes.

6. Make coating - Microwave chocolate chips and coconut oil in 30-second increments, stirring between each, until melted.

7. Dip cookies - Dip cookie bottoms in chocolate, scrape excess, and place on cool parchment. Drizzle tops if desired. Allow 30 minutes for chocolate to fully set.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/chocolate-covered-strawberry-cookies/)

meals.name: Maple Pecan Crumble Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Maple Pecan Crumble Cookies

**Yield:** 14 cookies
**Prep:** 30 min | **Bake:** 12-15 min

### Ingredients

**Cinnamon Sugar Swirl:**
- 1/4 cup light brown sugar, packed
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon

**Cookies:**
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 3/4 cup light brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons pure maple syrup
- 1 egg, room temperature
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon maple extract
- 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda

**Maple Pecan Crumble Topping:**
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 3 tablespoons light brown sugar, packed
- 1 teaspoon pure maple syrup
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 3 tablespoons chopped pecans
- Pinch of salt

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.

2. Make cinnamon sugar - Mix brown sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl; set aside.

3. Cream butter - In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, beat butter and brown sugar until light and airy (about 2 minutes).

4. Add wet ingredients - Scrape down bowl sides; add maple syrup, egg, vanilla, and maple extract. Beat until smooth and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

5. Mix dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix on low speed, increasing to high until no flour streaks remain; do not overmix.

6. Add swirl - Fold in the cinnamon-sugar mixture one or two times to create visible swirls; avoid overmixing.

7. Make crumble - In a separate bowl, combine all streusel topping ingredients; mix with a fork until crumbly.

8. Shape and top - Scoop dough using a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop onto prepared baking sheet. Flatten tops slightly and top each with a heaping spoonful of streusel, pressing firmly.

9. Bake - 12-15 minutes until edges are set but centers remain slightly doughy. Cool completely before serving.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/maple-pecan-crumble-cookies/)

meals.name: Chewy Chocolate Gingerbread Cookies
meals.instructions:
## Chewy Chocolate Gingerbread Cookies

**Yield:** 14 cookies
**Prep:** 20 min | **Bake:** 12 min

### Ingredients
- 3/4 cup unsalted butter
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/3 cup molasses
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 1/2 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder
- 2 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 2 teaspoons ground ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/3 cup cane sugar (for rolling)

### Instructions

1. Preheat and prep - Preheat oven to 350°F; line two cookie sheets with parchment paper.

2. Cream butter - Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes).

3. Add wet ingredients - Mix in molasses and vanilla extract until combined. Add egg and beat well.

4. Mix dry ingredients - In a separate bowl, combine cocoa, flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, nutmeg, and salt.

5. Combine - Add dry ingredients to wet mixture; beat until combined with no flour streaks remaining.

6. Shape cookies - Using a 1.5-ounce cookie scoop, portion cookies. Roll in cane sugar if desired; place 2 inches apart on prepared sheets.

7. Bake - 12 minutes until puffed and crinkled with gooey centers. Cool completely before transferring to wire rack.

---
[Original recipe](https://bromabakery.com/chewy-chocolate-gingerbread-cookies/)
